result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick David Brimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: CONDITIONS PERTAIN TO ALL COUNTS: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling. Review in six months. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted under jail rules. May transfer to Dane County Jail on EMP.

AMENDED: Jail start time amended to 5 a.m., same start date.

Cases called: 15CF311 & 15CF472, Defendant Patrick David Brimmer in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 3,4,5 in 15CF311. Court found defendant guilty. Sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conditions on ct. 3, 30 days jail start Nov. 29, 2016. Huber granted, may transfer to Dane Cty. Jail on EMP.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Review in 6 months. Domestic abuse counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample. $543 costs. On ct. 4, 2 yr. probation, $343 costs. On count 5, 2 year probation, $243 costs. 3 days jail credit. In 15CF472, count one amended to misdemeanor bailjumping. Court imposed $443 costs. 1 day jail credit. Ct 2&3 dismissed. 15TR6606, no contest plea. $937.50 fine, 9 mo. revocation, 12 mo. IID, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. 15TR6607 dismissed.
